message.content:
cs.CR, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.SE 

This paper deals with forecasting cyber attacks using Bayesian State Space Model and Markov model. It also discusses the use of analyst-detected incidents from a large operational Computer Security Service Provider (CSSP) for the U.S. Department of Defense. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The paper also uses machine learning techniques for forecasting, which makes cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning) likely sub-categories. The paper also discusses the potential applications of cyber event forecasting, which makes cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with the development of effective risk-management strategies, which makes cs.SE (Software Engineering) a possible sub-category.
